intro: Breonadia microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed burweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds, typical of the genus Breonadia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils. Its compact growth habit and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
